fields.text:
Main page

After you log in, you are on the main page, where you can see list of all available sites. As super administrator you have access to every site stored in the system.

You can filter sites, using filters located above the site list - just type or select requred values and press the "Apply Filters" button. To remove filtering - clear text filter fields and select "All" value in dropdown fields and press "Apply Filters" button.

To the right of each site there are "Detail" and "Assign" links. The "Detail" link opens Site Detail page. The "Assign" link opens menu whith to choices: "Assign Surveyor" leading to Inspection add form and "Grant Test Permission" leading to Test Permission add form.

At the top of the page there is main menu. Its central part differs for different pages. On the Site List page it has only one link "Add Site" which opens site adding form. Other menu links available on every page. "BFP" link leads directly to the main page. "Menu" is a dropdown from where you can access different parts of the system.

  • "Administration" link opens main administration interface available only to super administrators. Any data can be added, edited or deleted from there.
  • "PWS" link opens list of PWS, from where you can add or edit them.
  • "Customers" link opens list of customers, from where they can be added or edited.
  • "Sites" link leads to the main (site list) page
  • "Inspections" link leads to the Inspection list from where inspections can be edited. Note, inspections can only be added from Site List or Site Detail pages via "Assign Surveyor" link.
  • "Test Permissions" link is similar to "Inspections" but opens Test Permissions list page
  • "Letters" link opens Letter list page. Currently it's not fully functional - you can see old letters, but can not add and send new ones.
  • "Users" link opens User list page, where you can see all the system users, grouped by their type. Users can be added or edited from here. As super administrator you may also add or edit users via Administration interface. This separate interface needed mostly for administrators as they should be able to add their employees to the system, but can not access the main Administrations interface.
  • "Import" should open Import page where data from MS Excel files can be imported, but currently it does nothing, as the import feature is not available yet.
  • "Batch Update" opens Batch Update page, where you can set multiple sites' next survey date or due install/test date.


Site Detail page

This page can be accessed from main (site list) page via "Detail" links for each site in the list.

Here you can see all of the selected site details like address, meter data, water supplies present and so on. Below Surveys for this site are present for each water supply type. If there is no some water supply type present on the site, you will see "not present" message like following:

In another case you will be able to add and browse surveys for this site. Note, that surveys are added for the active service type. So if you are at the "Potable" tab then "Add Survey" button will add surveys with "potable" service type.

"Detail" link to the right of each survey allows you to browse that survey details, while "Add Hazard" link is a shortcut for adding more hazards to selected survey.

In the central part of the top menu you can see different links. "Edit" link opens editing form for the site. "Assign" link is similar to "Assign" link on the main page: it opens menu with two choices, one for assigning surveyor and another one for granting test permission. "Site List" link just returns you back to the main page.


Site Add/Edit form

This form is used for adding/editing sites. Fields are grouped by meaning as on few other forms.

The only special thing about this form is the customer field. When you click "Select Customer" button a modal is opened with customer list and filters. This is made in order to make it easier and faster to select a customer. To select one just click green "Select" button to the right of the customer. To hide the modal without making selection, click anywhere outside it on the page (dark-gray).



Survey Detail page

Similar to the Site Detail page, this one has survey detail part at the top and hazards list below. This page can be accessed via detail links in the survey list on the Site Detail page. From here you can edit survey via link in the top menu, add and browse hazards. "Add Test" link to the right of each hazard is a shortcut for creating new Test for selected Hazard.



Hazard Detail page

Hazard contais data related to hazard itself like location and hazard type and to bfp-device installed for that hazard. From here you can edit hazard, add and edit tests for that hazard.

Similar to previous detail pages there is a list at the bottom of the page, which contains all tests for this hazard. But this time instead of a table there is a spoiler list. Just click test header with it's date and result and it will expand showing you all the test detail. Click test header again to hide test detail.



Customers

Customer list page can be accessed via top menu. Here you can browse customers and gain access to their detail pages, adding and editing them.



PWS

PWS list page can be accessed via top menu. PWS has only six data fields, so there is no seprate "PWS Detail" page. All the PWS data is displayed in one table. From here you can add or edit PWS.



Users

Users list page, which can be accessed via top menu, is a separate user managing interface create for administrators. As super administrator you can manage users via main administration interface, but you may use this one as well. From here you can add or edit users.

Each user has few important fields. Of course, each of them shoud have username (login) and password. Each of them should belong to one of administrative groups (SuperAdministrators, Administrators, Surveyors, Testers). Each of them except Super Administrators should have his PWS specified. Administrators have access only to the data related to their PWS. Also, this is required for filtering: for example, administrator can not assign surveyor from another PWS, so PWS should be specified for surveyors and testers too.



Inspections and Test Permissions

Inspections are used to assign surveyors. Only administrators and superadministrators have access to this feature. Surveyors can see only sites specified in inspections assigned to them. Inspection has six fields: Site, Assigned To, Assigned By, Assigned Date, Is Active, Notes. When you are adding it from Site List page, you only have to fill in one field: Assigned To, where you select which surveyor should perform survey. "Assigned By" field's value is automatically set to current logged in user, "Assigned Date" field takes current date as value, "Site" is specified by the site from which you have opened the Inspection Add form. "Is Active" is set to "Yes" by default, and is turned off, when surveyor finishes survey and commits the site. Sites from non-active inspections are not shown to surveyors. As super administrator you may edit inspections and manually deactivate and reactivate them.

Test Permissions are similar to inspections, but they are granted to testers, so they can install or test bfp-devices at the specified site and commit it after.



Batch Update page

This page can be accessed via top menu. Here you can batch update fields "Next Survey Date" for multiple sites and "Due Install/Test Date" for multiple sites' hazards. Sites can be filtered. To select a site, click checkbox to the left of that site. If you want to select or deselect all the sites on the page, click checkbox in the table header. Then input required date and click one of the green buttons to perform update.



Super Administrator Special: Licences

Licences are given to local administrators to grant them access to the system. Licences can only be accessed via administrative interface.

Licence have six fields: "Given To" - user, to whom the licence is granted, "Given By" - user, who gave the licence, "Start Date", "End Date", "Is Active", "Notes".



Super Administrator Special: DropDown Data

This is the data, which required for dropdowns in other forms: Site Types, Hazard Types, BP Sizes, Test Manufacturers, etc. This data can be added, edited or deleted only by super administrator via main administration interface.



Super Administrator Special: Editing this help page

There is a special data model called "Static Text". It stores large static data, like help texts for different types of users.

Group field specifies, who may see this text. If it's not specified, then everyone will be able to see the text on the help page.

fields.title: Admin Help

fields.text:
Main page

After you log in, you are on the main page, where you can see list of all available sites. As surveyor, you can only see the sites which are assigned to you (sites are assigned by administrator).

You can filter sites, using filters located above the site list - just type or select requred values and press the "Apply Filters" button. To remove filtering - clear text filter fields and select "All" value in dropdown fields and press "Apply Filters" button.

To the right of each site there is "Detail" link, which opens Site Detail page.



Site Detail page

This page can be accessed from main (site list) page via "Detail" links for each site in the list.

Here you can see all of the selected site details like address, meter data, water supplies present and so on. Surveys for this site are present below for each water supply type. If there is no some water supply type present on the site, you will see "not present" message like following:

In another case you will be able to add a survey to each of water supply types present.

"Detail" link to the right of a survey allows you to browse that survey details, while "Add Hazard" link is a shortcut for adding more hazards to selected survey.

After you have finished survey and added all required hazards to it, press "Commit" button from the top menu. This makes survey considered to be done and hides related site from your site list, so you need to be assigned again by an administrator to be able to add another survey for that site.



Survey Detail page

Similar to the Site Detail page, this one has survey detail part at the top and hazards list below. This page can be accessed via detail links in the survey list on the Site Detail page. From here you can edit survey via link in the top menu, add and browse hazards.



Hazard Detail page

Hazard contais data related to hazard itself like location and hazard type and to bfp-device installed for that hazard. Here you can browse hazard details and edit hazard via "Edit" link from the top menu.
fields.title: Surveyor Help

fields.text:
Main page

After you log in, you are on the main page, where you can see list of all available sites. As tester, you can see only permitted sites. To get permission, please contact an administrator.

You can filter sites, using filters located above the site list - just type or select requred values and press the "Apply Filters" button. To remove filtering - clear text filter fields and select "All" value in dropdown fields and press "Apply Filters" button.

To the right of each site there is "Detail" link, which opens Site Detail page.



Site Detail page

This page can be accessed from main (site list) page via "Detail" links for each site in the list.

Here you can see all of the selected site details like address, meter data, water supplies present and so on. Hazards for this site are present below for each water supply type. If there is no some water supply type present on the site, you will see "not present" message like following:

"Detail" link to the right of a hazard allows you to browse that hazard details. "Add Test" link is shortcut for adding more tests.

After you have finished entering test data or newly installed bfp device data from hazard detail page, press "Commit" button from the top menu. This makes your job considered to be done and hides related site from your site list, so you need to get another test permission from an administrator for the another test.



Hazard Detail page

Hazard contais data related to hazard itself like location and hazard type and to bfp-device installed for that hazard. Here you can browse hazard details and edit hazard via "Edit" link from the top menu. Note, you can only edit bfp-device related data. Below hazard detail you may see test list. Click the test header to expand or hide test detail.
